cookies.message: This website uses a third party cookie to collect anonymous usage statistics and enhance the user experience (Google Analytics).

home.by: by the Buddhist Digital Resource Center
home.subtitle: A cooperative platform for expanding access to Buddhist literature. Explore the millions of pages of texts contributed by BDRC and its many partners.
home.message: WELCOME TO BUDA, BDRC's NEW LIBRARY!
home.submessage: with new features, resources, and tools for faster and more in-depth research.
home.subsubmessage: We welcome your feedback. Help us improve by sending bug reports, comments and suggestions to

home.subsubmessage_account2: for a free BDRC account for full access. Click on the
home.subsubmessage_account3: link above to create a new account.
home.subsubmessage_auth: All users, including users with existing accounts on tbrc.org, will need to register for a free BDRC account for full access.
home.start: Start typing then select search language

section1.title: The Khmer Manuscript Heritage Project
section1.text: <parag>The Buddhist Digital Resource Center launched the Khmer Manuscript Heritage Project in 2019 to safeguard the literary heritage of Cambodia through the digitization of surviving traditional palm-leaf manuscripts. In two and a half years, in collaboration with Digital Divide Data, The Brechin Group Inc., the Fonds pour l'Édition des Manuscrits du Cambodge, and the École française d’Extrême-Orient, BDRC sought out significant collections in Phnom Penh and surrounding provinces. Trained by manuscript and digitization experts, local Cambodian youth cleaned, organized, and digitized the manuscript collections, and the digital files were archived in BDRC’s repository for long-term preservation.</parag><parag>The resulting digital collection <nbsp>—56</nbsp> terabytes consisting of 1,456,341 <nbsp>pages—</nbsp> represents the majority of manuscripts known to have survived to the present in Cambodia. The project provides the world with free access to an unparalleled collection of traditional Cambodian literature.</parag><parag>The Khmer Manuscript Heritage Project was made possible with generous support from <lk target='_blank' href='https://www.akhmerbuddhistfoundation.org/'>A Khmer Buddhist Temple Foundation</lk>.</parag>
section1.caption: Illustrated leporello manuscript from Siem Reap (<lk to='/show/bdr:W1FEMC039097'>link</lk>)

section2.title: Resources
section2.text: <parag>Relevant bibliographies and secondary sources concerning Cambodian manuscripts <nbsp>—coming soon</nbsp>. </parag>

home.help: <bold>Please consult the <lk href='/buda-user-guide'>user guide</lk> and <lk href='https://www.bdrc.io/buda-user-guide/frequently-asked-questions/'>FAQ</lk> to learn more about BUDA</bold>
home.collec: <h>BDRC offers a digital acquisition program for research libraries, the Core Text Collection (CTC), now with an updated interface for convenient searching and browsing.</h><h><bold>Each of the 18 CTC hard drives contains curated volumes from BDRC’s holdings curated by our librarians and drawn from our most recent acquisitions.</bold></h><h>Please ask your institution’s librarian about subscribing.<nl/>For more information and assistance, email <lk href='mailto:dechen@bdrc.io'>dechen@bdrc.io</lk>.</h>
home.subtitle_new: Access almost any text from the major Buddhist traditions. BUDA contains 30 million pages scanned from the precious originals, and 5 million pages of etexts.

topbar.proxied: This is a proxied version provided by your institution's library subscription; login is disabled. If you are part of a subscribing institution, you can download PDFs of texts in the subscribed collections. If you have an account and wish to use it, please go to <tag href='https://{{library}}' target='_blank'>https://{{library}}</tag>
topbar.collections: Browse collections subscribed to by your institution
topbar.update: Update to latest version of BUDA
topbar.preserving: Preserving Buddhist literature for the world

tibetan.title: Tibetan: Unicode, Wylie or English phonetics
tibetan.body: Searching in Tibetan do not require exact orthography. Phonetics in English (ex: <ita>Chenrezig</ita>), approximate spelling in Tibetan or Wylie work.<nl/><nl/>Partial matches are returned in titles and names but only full matches are returned in etexts.

codes.title: Codes and dates
codes.body: Searching ISBN numbers, BDRC numbers (ex: <ita>MW22084</ita>), Derge Canon numbers (ex: <ita>D24</ita>) and several other systems is supported. Dates should also return relevant results directly (ex: <ita>1745</ita>).

AND.title: Exact match and query combination
AND.body: Surrounding your query in double quotes (<ita>"</ita>) will only find matches that are strictly identical to your query. Combining two or more phrases with the keyword <ita>AND</ita> (upper cased, as in <ita>sde dge AND bka' 'gyur</ita>) will find results that contain all the phrases but not necessarily adjacent (for instance they can be in different fields).

chinese.title: Chinese
chinese.body: The search will return the same results for Traditional and Simplified characters but Pinyin search is not implemented.

sanskrit.title: Sanskrit and Pali
sanskrit.body: Sanskrit and Pali are searched in transliteration only, but diacritics are not required.

khmer.title: Khmer and Burmese: Unicode
khmer.body: Search in Khmer and Burmese works best in Unicode, but searching in transliteration will work to some extent.

scope.title: Scopes of search
scope.body: When the search box is on a yellow background and says “Search the Digital Archives”, it covers everything we have. When the search bar is on white background it will search on a limited subset of the database and will indicate it (for example “Search in outline”).

filters.noresults: There are no results matching your search: {{keyword}} [{{language}}] {{type}}
filters.noresultsAsso: There are no associated results for {{keyword}} {{type}}
filters.persons: <parag>BDRC contains thousands of person records, you may want to try modifying your search to get the best results.<newline/><list>Search on a shorter string of syllables by eliminating titles, geographical names, and so on<newline/>Ex: <ita>'jam dbyangs nor bu</ita> instead of <ita>co ne sa skyong 'jam dbyangs nor bu</ita></list><list>Double check your search for typos</list><list>Try searching <lnk>in English</lnk> instead of pure Extended Wylie</list></parag>
filters.instances: <parag>BDRC contains thousands of texts, you may want to try modifying your search to get the best results.<newline/><list>Search on a shorter string of syllables, preferably the core part of the title<newline/>Ex: <ita>lam rim chung ngu'i zin bris</ita> instead of <ita>lam rim chung ngu'i zin bris blo gsal rgya mtsho'i 'jug ngogs</ita></list><list>Double check your search for typos</list><list>Try searching <lnk>in English</lnk> instead of pure Extended Wylie</list></parag>
filters.error: There was an error processing your search: {{keyword}} [{{language}}] {{type}}<newline/>Please check syntax or try another search
filters.generic: <parag>BDRC contains thousands of records, you may want to try modifying your search to get the best results.<newline/><list>Search on a shorter string of syllables, preferably the core part of the title<newline/>Ex: <ita>lam rim chung ngu'i zin bris</ita> instead of <ita>lam rim chung ngu'i zin bris blo gsal rgya mtsho'i 'jug ngogs</ita></list><list>You can also search on a shorter string of syllables by eliminating titles, geographical names, and so on<newline/>Ex: <ita>'jam dbyangs nor bu</ita> instead of <ita>co ne sa skyong 'jam dbyangs nor bu</ita></list><list>Double check your search for typos</list></parag>

resource.helpWorkId: A <italic>Work</italic> in the BDRC context represents the conceptual essence of the cataloged resource: authors, languages, and what it is about (subjects). It connects together all the versions. See the user guide for more.
resource.workId1: See the "work" page which combines all the different versions of this text.

access.fairuse1: BDRC <bold>restricts access</bold> to this work (only the first and last 20 images are available online) because the work is under <bold>copyright</bold>.
access.fairuse3: for information about possibly accessing this work under fair use.
access.sealed: BDRC <bold>restricts access</bold> to this work because it was provided to BDRC on the condition that we respect <bold>traditional restrictions</bold> applied to it. If you have received the proper transmission from a spiritual teacher to access this work or have other questions about how to access this work please contact
access.limited20: Access limited to first & last 20 pages.
access.credentials: if you have sufficient credentials to get access to all scans from this work.
access.error: An error occurred while trying to access the images
access.generic: BDRC has restricted access to this work in accordance with our access policies. You can read those policies here: <policies href='https://bdrc.io/access-policies/' target='_blank'>https://bdrc.io/access-policies/</policies>
access.OCR: These etexts were created through OCR (optical character recognition), not manually input, and have not been edited. OCR for Tibetan script is not 100% perfect but it is accurate enough to create text that will enhance the BDRC database. We hope that etexts like these improve the discoverability and usefulness of the BDRC archive for you.
access.quality0: We apologize for the poor quality of these scans, which might be in the wrong order or have other issues which may make them difficult to read. Because these may still be useful for scholarship, research or practice, we have chosen to make these available, while we continue to search for higher quality images.
access.fairUseIA1: This work is <bold>copyrighted by a third party</bold>. As a result, BDRC can only make very limited portions available for private research and study. The full text of the work is viewable on Internet Archive, a close partner of ours, through their Open Library program.
access.fairUseIA2: Borrow this text from Internet Archive
access.fairUseIA3: The scans are available through the <lk>Internet Archive's Open Library Program <icon /></lk>
access.fairUseIA4: BDRC can make limited portions available for private research and study upon request.
access.imageN: (this image is copyrighted and not available)
access.fairuseEtext: BDRC <bold>restricts access</bold> to this work because the work is under <bold>copyright</bold>.
access.snippetV: View a small snippet at BDRC
access.OCRnew: <bold>These etexts were created through OCR (optical character recognition), not manually input, and have not been edited.</bold><nl/>OCR for Tibetan script is not 100% perfect but it is accurate enough to create text that will enhance the BDRC database. We hope that etexts like these improve the discoverability and usefulness of the BDRC archive for you.
access.errorE: An error occurred while trying to access the etext
access.redirect: This is an internal page, please go to<nl/><lnk>{{url}}</lnk><nl/>for the user page.
